Get the number of elements in a GLSL symbol type

void setupUnaryBuiltInFuncCall (  const TString &  name,
TIntermUnary *  node,
TString &  opStr,
bool &  funcStyle,
bool &  prefix,
TGlslOutputTraverser *  goit
) 
 

Helper function to output a imaru built-in function call. If it is a matrix, generates the appropriate xlat_lib function

Parameters:
name Name of function to call
node Unary node to traverse
opStr Operator string name (e.g. "radians")
funcStyle Reference to function style, will be set to true
pre Reference to prefix, will be set to true
goit GLSL traverser

Helper function to output a comparison operator

Parameters:
compareOp Scalar comparison op (e.g. "==", "!=",..)
compareCall Vector comparison call (e.g. "equal", "notEqual",..)
node Node to output
goit GLSL traverser

EGlslSymbolType  t,
constUnion *  c,
GlslStruct *  str = 0
) 
 

Helper function to output a constructor of all constants

Parameters:
out Output string buffer
t GLSL symbol type to output
c Constant union holding values to pass to constructor
str If a structure, contains the GLSL structure pointer (default is NULL)
Returns:
The number of elements in the GLSL symbol type, 0 if unknown type

void writeFuncCall (  const TString &  name,
TIntermAggregate *  node,
TGlslOutputTraverser *  goit,
bool  bGenMatrix = false
) 
 

Helper function to output a function call

Parameters:
name Name of function to call
node Aggregate node of function parameters
goit GLSL traverser
bGenMatrix If true, this function will generate a call to the xlat_lib matrix version of the function if the node is a matrix.
